intro: Disparago lasiocarpa, commonly known as the woolly bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and distinctive, inflated seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush communities. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Disparago lasiocarpa is an important part of local ecosystems, providing food for various insects and small animals.
